result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd B. Bergman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Todd B. Bergman in court with attorney Jessica Marie Moeller.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews agreement.  Court reviews charge/penalty.  DE pleads No Contest to Count 1.  Court reviews PQWOR with defendant.  Court finds factual basis, plea made FVKI, accepts plea and finds guilty of count 1.  Atty. Tienstra is heard on recommendation.  Atty. Moeller is heard, requests he report to P&P tomorrow as he already has appointment set.  Mr. Bergman does not make statement.  Court is heard and sentence imposed:

Sentence withheld:
Probation for 1 year, or until restitution is paid in full, with conditions:
Pay restitution of $198.00.
Court Costs and fees.  

2 days presentence credit.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-21-2015 09:15 am
